bugs.title: CVE-2023-39320 golang: cmd/go: go.mod toolchain directive allows arbitrary execution

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-39320 golang: cmd/go: go.mod toolchain directive allows arbitrary execution

long_desc.thetext: The go.mod toolchain directive, introduced in Go 1.21, could be leveraged to execute scripts and binaries relative to the root of the module when the "go" command was executed within the module. This applies to modules downloaded using the "go" command from the module proxy, as well as modules downloaded directly using VCS software.

Created golang tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2238804]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2238805]

bugs.title: CVE-2023-39318 golang: html/template:  improper handling of HTML-like comments within script contexts

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-39318 golang: html/template: improper handling of HTML-like comments within script contexts

long_desc.thetext: The html/template package did not properly handle HMTL-like "<!--" and "-->"comment tokens, nor hashbang "#!" comment tokens, in <script> contexts. This may cause the template parser to improperly interpret the contents of <script> contexts, causing actions to be improperly escaped. This could be leveraged to perform an XSS attack.

Created golang tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2238806]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2238807]

  NETWORK-OBSERVABILITY-1.4.0-RHEL-9

bugs.title: CVE-2023-39321 golang: crypto/tls: panic when processing post-handshake message on QUIC connections

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-39321 golang: crypto/tls: panic when processing post-handshake message on QUIC connections

long_desc.thetext: Processing an incomplete post-handshake message for a QUIC connection caused a panic.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-39322 golang: crypto/tls: lack of a limit on buffered post-handshake

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-39322 golang: crypto/tls: lack of a limit on buffered post-handshake

long_desc.thetext:
Once the TLS handshake completes, QUICConn.HandleData buffers data and passes it to handlePostHandshakeMessage every time the buffer contains a complete message. The size check is wrong, however, so it can pass along a partial message, triggering a panic when handlePostHandshakeMessage tries to read the remainder of the message.

In addition, HandleData doesn't limit the amount of data it can buffer. It should reject messages larger than maxHandshake.

Created golang tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2238811]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2238812]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  NETWORK-OBSERVABILITY-1.4.0-RHEL-9

bugs.title: CVE-2023-39320 golang: cmd/go: go.mod toolchain directive allows arbitrary execution [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-39320 golang: cmd/go: go.mod toolchain directive allows arbitrary execution [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-39320 golang: cmd/go: go.mod toolchain directive allows arbitrary execution

long_desc.thetext: The go.mod toolchain directive, introduced in Go 1.21, could be leveraged to execute scripts and binaries relative to the root of the module when the "go" command was executed within the module. This applies to modules downloaded using the "go" command from the module proxy, as well as modules downloaded directly using VCS software.

Created golang tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2238804]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2238805]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2237775

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2237775,2238804

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-EPEL-2023-1c906d04ee has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-1c906d04ee

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-1c906d04ee has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-1c906d04ee

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-1c906d04ee has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-39321 golang: crypto/tls: panic when processing post-handshake message on QUIC connections [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-39321 golang: crypto/tls: panic when processing post-handshake message on QUIC connections [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-39321 golang: crypto/tls: panic when processing post-handshake message on QUIC connections

long_desc.thetext: Processing an incomplete post-handshake message for a QUIC connection caused a panic.

Created golang tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2238808]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2238809]

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

bugs.title: CVE-2023-39322 golang: crypto/tls: lack of a limit on buffered post-handshake [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-39322 golang: crypto/tls: lack of a limit on buffered post-handshake [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-39322 golang: crypto/tls: lack of a limit on buffered post-handshake

long_desc.thetext:
Once the TLS handshake completes, QUICConn.HandleData buffers data and passes it to handlePostHandshakeMessage every time the buffer contains a complete message. The size check is wrong, however, so it can pass along a partial message, triggering a panic when handlePostHandshakeMessage tries to read the remainder of the message.

In addition, HandleData doesn't limit the amount of data it can buffer. It should reject messages larger than maxHandshake.

Created golang tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2238811]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2238812]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  NETWORK-OBSERVABILITY-1.4.0-RHEL-9

bugs.title: CVE-2023-39323 golang: cmd/go: line directives allows arbitrary execution during build

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-39323 golang: cmd/go: line directives allows arbitrary execution during build

long_desc.thetext:
Line directives ("//line") can be used to bypass the restrictions on "//go:cgo_" directives, allowing blocked linker and compiler flags to be passed during compilation. This can result in unexpected execution of arbitrary code when running "go build". The line directive requires the absolute path of the file in which the directive lives, which makes exploiting this issue significantly more complex.

https://pkg.go.dev/vuln/GO-2023-2095
https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/XBa1oHDevAo
https://go.dev/cl/533215
https://go.dev/issue/63211

Created golang tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2243693]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2243694]
could you drop an email for the CVSS rescore to NVD
